articles.title: Horror 68-day warning for Australia - news.com.au
articles.description: Australia now has a “serious national security problem” when it comes to fuel supply — with a report revealing we would have just 68 days of fuel reserves to keep us going in the event of an international crisis.

articles.title: Australian scientists to power Tesla on 15000km trip with printed solar panels - CNA
articles.description:
GOSFORTH, Australia: Scientists in Australia are testing printed solar panels they will use to power a Tesla on a 15,100km journey beginning in September, which they hope will get the public thinking about steps to help avert climate change.

articles.content:
Printed solar is a lightweight, laminated PET plastic that can be made at a cost of less than US$10 a square metre.

articles.title: Free books: Aesop Women's Library launches in Singapore - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: As part of the Australian beauty brand’s inaugural initiative to celebrate women’s stories and voices, you can pick up a complimentary book for yourself or a loved one, from Wednesday (Apr 20) to Sunday.
